meanings.definition: A substance used to treat or prevent disease.
meanings.sent1: My mom gave me some medicine when I had a fever.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often prescribe medicine to help patients get better.
meanings.sent3: The medicine tasted so bad, I thought it might make me sicker!
meanings.sent4: Laughter is the best medicine, they say, but sometimes you need actual medicine.
meanings.sent5: The medicine was like a magic potion, making the pain disappear instantly.

meanings.definition: The science or practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease.
meanings.sent1: Studying medicine requires a lot of dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent2: Modern medicine has made great advancements in the treatment of various illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show about clumsy doctors practicing medicine always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of uncertainties, medicine provides a sense of control and hope.
meanings.sent5: The art of medicine involves not just treating the body, but also caring for the soul.

meanings.definition: A remedy or treatment for a particular ailment.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's homemade chicken soup is my favorite medicine when I'm feeling sick.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes a kind word can be the best medicine for a broken heart.
meanings.sent3: The medicine of friendship can heal wounds that no ointment can reach.
meanings.sent4: Nature's medicine, like fresh air and sunshine, can work wonders for the spirit.
meanings.sent5: Music has always been my medicine, lifting my mood when I'm feeling down.
